item.title: Chipmaker Patch Tuesday: Intel, AMD, Nvidia Fix High-Severity Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Chipmakers Intel, AMD and Nvidia on Tuesday published new security advisories to inform customers about vulnerabilities found in their products. 

The post Chipmaker Patch Tuesday: Intel, AMD, Nvidia Fix High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of February 10, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of February 10, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Cisco Says Ransomware Group’s Leak Related to Old Hack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A fresh post on the Kraken ransomware group’s leak website refers to data stolen in a 2022 cyberattack, Cisco says.

The post Cisco Says Ransomware Group’s Leak Related to Old Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Vulnerabilities Addressed by Schneider Electric, Siemens
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Industrial giants Schneider Electric and Siemens have released February 2025 Patch Tuesday ICS security advisories.

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Vulnerabilities Addressed by Schneider Electric, Siemens appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cybercrime Threatens National Security, Google Threat Intel Team Says
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
On the eve of the Munich Security Conference, Google argues that the cybercriminal threat should be treated as a national security threat like state-backed hacking groups.

The post Cybercrime Threatens National Security, Google Threat Intel Team Says appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft Patches ‘Wormable’ Windows Flaw and File-Deleting Zero-Day
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The Microsoft Patch Tuesday machine hummed loudly this month with urgent fixes for a pair of already-exploited Windows zero-days.

The post Microsoft Patches ‘Wormable’ Windows Flaw and File-Deleting Zero-Day appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Adobe Plugs 45 Software Security Holes, Warns of Code Execution Risks
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Patch Tuesday: Adobe patches 45 vulnerabilities across multiple products and warns of remote code execution exploitation risks.

The post Adobe Plugs 45 Software Security Holes, Warns of Code Execution Risks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Russian Cybercrime Network Targeted for Sanctions Across US, UK and Australia
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Russia-based bulletproof hosting services provider Zservers was sanctioned for providing services to support LockBit ransomware operations.

The post Russian Cybercrime Network Targeted for Sanctions Across US, UK and Australia appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: High-Severity OpenSSL Vulnerability Found by Apple Allows MitM Attacks
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
OpenSSL has patched CVE-2024-12797, a high-severity vulnerability found by Apple that can allow man-in-the-middle attacks.

The post High-Severity OpenSSL Vulnerability Found by Apple Allows MitM Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SAP Releases 21 Security Patches
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
SAP has released 19 new and two updated security notes on its February 2025 patch day, including six notes for high-severity vulnerabilities.

The post SAP Releases 21 Security Patches appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Authorities Disrupt 8Base Ransomware, Arrest Four Russian Operators
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Law enforcement agencies take down the 8Base ransomware group’s infrastructure, arrest four Russian operators.

The post Authorities Disrupt 8Base Ransomware, Arrest Four Russian Operators appeared first on SecurityWeek.
